intro: Evaiezoa laurentiana, commonly known as the Laurentian laurel, is a shrub native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic plants like cinnamon and avocado. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are glossy and have a distinct, spicy fragrance. Evaiezoa laurentiana typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local wildlife.
